reg.title: Hotel Room Tax Regulation for the Mount Washington Resort Association
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 116/2011, June 20, 2011]

definition.def: means the Hotel Room Tax Act;

means a portion of the Comox Valley Regional District Electoral Area C outlined in the "Plan Area and Ownership" map in Schedule J attached to Regional District of Comox-Strathcona bylaw No. 2042, 1998.

section.sectiontext: December 31, 2009, is the prescribed date after which section 3 of the Act applies in respect of accommodation purchased in the Resort Area.
The tax payable under section 3 (1) of the Act is 2% of the purchase price of accommodation purchased in the Resort Area.

section.marginalnote: Prescribed purpose for expenditure of tax
section.sectiontext: The Mount Washington Resort Association may spend the amount paid to it out of the revenue collected from the tax for tourism marketing, programs and projects.
This regulation is repealed effective January 1, 2015.

footnote.footnotetext: See section 45 of the Provincial Sales Tax Transitional Provisions and Amendments Act, 2013, S.B.C. 2013, c. 1

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Hotel Room Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 207, section 43 (2) (e) and (f)]
